main event: An intermittent bright light was observed traveling at high speed over Malvern, Pennsylvania on May 20, 1955.
interesting points: The light was moving at an estimated speed of over 2,000 mph,No sound was heard except for a thunder-type sound during the initial sighting,The light diminished in intensity as it traveled and finally disappeared,The observation lasted from thirty seconds to about one and a half minutes,The initial report was not received until over a month after the event.
sighted object: one intermittent bright light in the sky
witness description: CDR W. H. HILLANDS, USN, a naval aviator with twenty years of experience
